description: A vulnerability was found in Pagure. An argument injection in Git during retrieval of the repository history leads to remote code execution on the Pagure instance.
summary: The vulnerability in Pagure allows hackers to remotely execute code on the Pagure instance by injecting arguments in Git during retrieval of the repository history. This affects users of Pagure instances. Users should update their Pagure software to the latest version to protect against this threat.

description: The Ultimate Dashboard – Custom WordPress Dashboard plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the handle_module_actions function in all versions up to, and including, 3.8.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to activate/deactivate plugin modules.
summary: The Ultimate Dashboard plugin for WordPress is at risk of being accessed and modified by unauthorized users. This vulnerability affects all versions up to 3.8.7 and allows attackers with Subscriber-level access or higher to activate or deactivate plugin modules. Users should update to version 3.8.8 or higher to fix this issue and prevent unauthorized access.
software: Ultimate Dashboard – Custom WordPress Dashboard plugin

description: The Advanced Woo Search plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's aws_search_terms shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 3.28 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: The Advanced Woo Search plugin for WordPress has a security vulnerability that allows attackers with contributor-level access or higher to inject malicious scripts into website pages. This could potentially impact any website using this plugin. To mitigate this threat, users should update to version 3.29 or later of the plugin, which includes fixes for this issue.

description: The Smart Maintenance Mode plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘setstatus’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.5.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The Smart Maintenance Mode plugin for WordPress is at risk of a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting attack. This vulnerability affects all versions up to 1.5.2. Unauthenticated attackers can inject harmful scripts into web pages, potentially tricking users into clicking on malicious links. Website administrators should update the plugin to version 1.5.3 or higher to mitigate this threat.
software: Smart Maintenance Mode plugin for WordPress

description: The SH Email Alert plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the 'mid' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The SH Email Alert plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to a type of cyber attack called Reflected Cross-Site Scripting, which allows attackers to inject harmful web scripts into a website. This vulnerability affects all versions up to 1.0 of the plugin and can be exploited by unauthenticated attackers. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to the latest version as soon as possible.
software: SH Email Alert plugin for WordPress

description: The Amazing service box Addons For WPBakery Page Builder (formerly Visual Composer) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 2.0.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses the SVG file.
summary: The Amazing service box Addons For WPBakery Page Builder plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that allows authenticated attackers to inject malicious scripts through SVG file uploads. This affects all versions up to 2.0.0 and can impact users with Author-level access or higher. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to the latest version and avoid uploading SVG files.
software: Amazing service box Addons For WPBakery Page Builder

description: The Ayyash Studio — The kick-start kit plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.3 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses the SVG file.
summary: This vulnerability in the Ayyash Studio plugin for WordPress allows attackers with Author-level access or higher to inject harmful scripts into web pages by uploading SVG files. All versions up to 1.0.3 are affected. Website owners should update to the latest version of the plugin to prevent this threat.

description: httpd.c in atophttpd 2.8.0 has an off-by-one error and resultant out-of-bounds read because a certain 1024-character req string would not have a final '\0' character.
summary: CVE-2021-4606 is a vulnerability found in atophttpd 2.8.0 that allows for an out-of-bounds read due to an off-by-one error in the software. This issue could potentially be exploited by an attacker to cause a denial of service or execute malicious code on the system running atophttpd. Users of atophttpd 2.8.0 are affected by this vulnerability, and they should update to a patched version that resolves the off-by-one error to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: The wp-svg-upload WordPress plugin through 1.0.0 does not sanitize SVG file contents, which enables users with at least the author role to SVG with malicious JavaScript to conduct Stored XSS attacks.
summary: The wp-svg-upload WordPress plugin allows users to upload SVG files without properly checking for malicious JavaScript. This vulnerability can be exploited by users with at least the author role to execute malicious code on a website, putting it at risk for cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to version 1.0.1 or higher, which includes a fix for this issue.

description: The Smart Maintenance Mode WordPress plugin before 1.5.2 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: This vulnerability in the Smart Maintenance Mode WordPress plugin allows attackers with high privileges, such as admins, to execute harmful code on a website even if certain restrictions are in place. Website admins should update to version 1.5.2 or higher to protect against this threat.

description: The Booknetic WordPress plugin before 4.1.5 does not have CSRF check when creating Staff accounts, which could allow attackers to make logged in admin add arbitrary Staff members via a CSRF attack
summary: The Booknetic WordPress plugin version 4.1.5 and earlier is vulnerable to a CSRF attack, where attackers could potentially add arbitrary staff members without proper authorization. This vulnerability affects WordPress websites using the Booknetic plugin. Users should update to version 4.1.5 or newer to patch this security issue and prevent potential unauthorized access.

description: The Spectra – WordPress Gutenberg Blocks plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the uagb block in all versions up to, and including, 2.19.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: The Spectra – WordPress Gutenberg Blocks plugin has a security flaw that allows attackers with certain levels of access to inject harmful scripts into WordPress pages. This vulnerability affects all versions up to 2.19.0. Users of this plugin should update it to the latest version to prevent potential attacks.

description: Huawei PCs have a vulnerability that allows low-privilege users to bypass SDDL permission checks . Successful exploitation this vulnerability could lead to termination of some system processes.
summary: Huawei PCs have a security flaw that allows users with low privileges to get around permission checks, potentially leading to the termination of system processes. This vulnerability could affect anyone using a Huawei PC. To address this issue, users should install the latest security updates from Huawei to protect their systems from potential attacks.

description: HCL SX does not set the secure attribute on authorization tokens or session cookies. Attackers may potentially be able to obtain access to the cookie values via a Cross-Site-Forgery-Request (CSRF).
summary: This vulnerability in HCL SX puts users at risk of having their authorization tokens or session cookies accessed by attackers through CSRF attacks. This affects any users of HCL SX. To mitigate this risk, users should ensure that the secure attribute is set on authorization tokens and session cookies.

description: The CRM and Lead Management by vcita plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's 'vCitaMeetingScheduler' and 'vCitaSchedulingCalendar' shortcodes in all versions up to, and including, 2.7.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: This vulnerability in the CRM and Lead Management by vcita plugin for WordPress allows attackers with contributor-level access or higher to inject harmful scripts into plugin's shortcodes, potentially affecting any user who visits a compromised page. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin (2.7.5) to protect against this exploit.
software: CRM and Lead Management by vcita plugin

description: The BWL Advanced FAQ Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data that can lead to a denial of service due to a missing capability check on the 'baf_set_notice_status' AJAX action in all versions up to, and including, 2.1.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to update option values to '1' on the WordPress site. This can be leveraged to update an option that would create an error on the site and deny service to legitimate users or be used to set some values to true such as registration.
summary: The BWL Advanced FAQ Manager plugin for WordPress is at risk of being exploited by attackers with Subscriber-level access or higher, allowing them to modify data and potentially cause a denial of service on the website. Users should update the plugin to version 2.1.5 or higher to mitigate this vulnerability.
software: BWL Advanced FAQ Manager plugin for WordPress

description: The Active Products Tables for WooCommerce. Use constructor to create tables plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized filter calling due to insufficient restrictions on the get_smth() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.6.7. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to call arbitrary WordPress filters with a single parameter.
summary: The Active Products Tables for WooCommerce plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that allows unauthenticated attackers to call arbitrary WordPress filters by exploiting the get_smth() function. This affects all versions up to 1.0.6.7. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to mitigate this threat.

description: The Newsletters plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the logging functionality in all versions up to, and including, 4.9.9.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: The Newsletters plugin for WordPress has a security vulnerability that allows attackers to inject harmful scripts into web pages. This could affect anyone using this plugin up to version 4.9.9.7. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to protect against this threat.

description: The Event post plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's 'events_list' shortcodes in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.9 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: There is a security vulnerability in the Event post plugin for WordPress which allows attackers with contributor-level access or higher to inject harmful web scripts through the plugin's 'events_list' shortcodes. This can affect WordPress websites using the plugin up to version 5.9.9. Website owners should update the plugin to the latest version and regularly monitor for any suspicious activity.

description: The Total Upkeep – WordPress Backup Plugin plus Restore & Migrate by BoldGrid plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution in all versions up to, and including, 1.16.10 via the compression_level setting. This is due to the plugin using the compression_level setting in proc_open() without any validation. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with administrator-level access and above, to execute code on the server.
summary: The Total Upkeep WordPress plugin is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution for versions up to 1.16.10. This means that attackers with administrator-level access can execute code on the server through the compression_level setting. Users should update to version 1.16.11 or later to mitigate this threat.
software: WordPress Backup Plugin plus Restore & Migrate by BoldGrid

description: The Jobs for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Directory Traversal in all versions up to, and including, 2.7.11 via the 'job_postings_get_file' parameter. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to read the contents of arbitrary files on the server, which can contain sensitive information.

This affects all versions up to 2.7.11. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to protect against this threat.

description: The Advanced iFrame plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's 'advanced_iframe' shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 2024.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: This vulnerability in the Advanced iFrame plugin for WordPress allows attackers with certain levels of access to insert harmful scripts into web pages, which can be executed whenever a user visits the compromised page. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

description: Improper permission control vulnerability in the OXARI ServiceDesk application could allow an attacker using a guest access or an unprivileged account to gain additional administrative permissions in the application.This issue affects OXARI ServiceDesk in versions before 2.0.324.0.
summary: This vulnerability in the OXARI ServiceDesk application could allow an attacker with guest or unprivileged access to gain administrative permissions. It affects versions before 2.0.324.0. Users should update to the latest version to patch this issue and prevent unauthorized access.

description:
DBIx::Class::EncodedColumn use the rand() function, which is not cryptographically secure to salt password hashes.

This vulnerability is associated with program files lib/DBIx/Class/EncodedColumn/Digest.pm.

This issue affects DBIx::Class::EncodedColumn until 0.00032.
summary: This vulnerability affects the DBIx::Class::EncodedColumn module, specifically versions up to 0.00032. The issue involves the use of the non-secure rand() function to salt password hashes, making them vulnerable to being compromised. Users of this module should update to the latest version to protect their password hashes.

description:
DBIx::Class::EncodedColumn use the rand() function, which is not cryptographically secure to salt password hashes.

This vulnerability is associated with program files Crypt/Eksblowfish/Bcrypt.pm.

This issue affects DBIx::Class::EncodedColumn until 0.00032.
summary: A vulnerability has been identified in a software library called DBIx::Class::EncodedColumn, which is used for salting password hashes. The issue stems from the insecure use of the rand() function for salting, making the password hashes vulnerable to attacks. This vulnerability affects versions of DBIx::Class::EncodedColumn up to 0.00032. Users of this software should update to a newer version that addresses this issue.

description: Session logout could be overwritten in Checkmk GmbH's Checkmk versions <2.3.0p30, <2.2.0p41, and 2.1.0p49 (EOL)
summary: This vulnerability in Checkmk software versions below 2.3.0p30, 2.2.0p41, and 2.1.0p49 (End of Life) allows attackers to overwrite session logout. This could affect users of the software who could inadvertently leave their sessions open, potentially exposing sensitive information. Users should update to the latest version of Checkmk to patch this vulnerability and ensure their sessions are securely logged out.

description: The Zapier for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 1.5.1 via the updated_user() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application which can be used to query and modify information from internal services.
summary: The Zapier for WordPress plugin is at risk of a server-side request forgery vulnerability, allowing authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access or higher to make unauthorized web requests. This could lead to information being accessed or modified from internal services. Users should update to version 1.5.2 or higher to mitigate this threat.

description: The WordPress Importer plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 0.8.3 via deserialization of untrusted input in the 'maybe_unserialize' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.
summary: The WordPress Importer plugin is at risk of a security vulnerability that allows authenticated attackers with Administrator level access or higher to inject a PHP Object. This vulnerability can only be exploited if another plugin or theme with a POP chain is present on the site. Users are advised to update the WordPress Importer plugin to version 0.8.4 or later to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: The Ultimate Blocks – WordPress Blocks Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the 'buttonTextColor’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.2.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: The Ultimate Blocks - WordPress Blocks Plugin plugin has a vulnerability that allows authenticated attackers with Contributor-level access and above to inject harmful scripts into webpages. This could affect anyone using this plugin up to version 3.2.7. description: The Product Import Export for WooCommerce – Import Export Product CSV Suite plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Directory Traversal in all versions up to, and including, 2.5.0 via the download_file() function. Users of this plugin should update to version 2.5.1 or higher to protect against this vulnerability.

summary: This plugin for WordPress allows attackers with high-level access to delete important files on the server, potentially causing data loss or other damage. It affects users of the Product Import Export for WooCommerce plugin versions up to 2.5.0. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to protect against this vulnerability.

description: The Product Import Export for WooCommerce – Import Export Product CSV Suite plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.5.0 via the validate_file() Function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query and modify information from internal services.
summary: This vulnerability in the Product Import Export for WooCommerce plugin allows attackers with Admin-level access to send malicious web requests to different locations through the web application. This could potentially lead to unauthorized access and modification of internal services. Users of this plugin should update to version 2.5.1 or higher to patch this vulnerability and prevent exploitation.

description: The Product Import Export for WooCommerce – Import Export Product CSV Suite plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 2.5.0 via deserialization of untrusted input from the 'form_data' parameter This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.
summary: The Product Import Export for WooCommerce plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection, which could allow authenticated attackers with Administrator-level access to inject harmful code into a website. This vulnerability only has an impact if another plugin or theme with a specific chain is installed on the site. Users should update the plugin to version 2.5.1 or higher to mitigate this risk.
software: Product Import Export for WooCommerce – Import Export Product CSV Suite

description: The WP Compress – Instant Performance & Speed Optimization plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access, modification, and loss of data due to missing capability checks on its on its AJAX functions in all versions up to, and including, 6.30.15. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to compromise the site in various ways depending on the specific function exploited - for example, by retrieving sensitive settings and configuration details, or by altering and deleting them, thereby disclosing sensitive information, disrupting the plugin’s functionality, and potentially impacting overall site performance.
summary: This vulnerability in the WP Compress plugin for WordPress allows attackers with subscriber-level access or higher to access, modify, and potentially delete sensitive data on a website. To address this issue, users should update the plugin to the latest version, 6.30.16, or disable it until a fix is available.
software: WP Compress – Instant Performance & Speed Optimization

description: The Responsive Addons for Elementor – Free Elementor Addons Plugin and Elementor Templates plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.8 the 'register_user' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to extract sensitive data including usernames and passwords of any users who register via the Edit Login | Registration Form widget, as long as that user opens the email notification for successful registration.
summary: The Responsive Addons for Elementor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to a security issue that allows authenticated attackers with Contributor-level access or higher to extract sensitive information such as usernames and passwords of users who register through a specific widget. Users of this plugin should update to version 1.6.9 or later to ensure their data is secure.

description: IBM Cognos Controller 11.0.0 through 11.1.0 is vulnerable to a Client-Side Desync (CSD) attack where an attacker could exploit a desynchronized browser connection that could lead to further cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
summary: This vulnerability in IBM Cognos Controller software could be exploited by an attacker to carry out cross-site scripting attacks. This has the potential to affect users of versions 11.0.0 through 11.1.0 of the software. Users should update to the latest version of the software to patch this vulnerability and protect against potential attacks.

description: A code execution vulnerability exists in the Xiaomi Game center application product. The vulnerability is caused by  improper input validation and can be exploited by attackers to execute malicious code.
summary: This vulnerability in the Xiaomi Game center app allows hackers to run harmful code on affected devices due to a lack of proper validation of input. Users of the Xiaomi Game center app should update to the latest version to patch this security flaw and protect their devices from potential attacks.

description: Icinga Director is an Icinga config deployment tool. A Security vulnerability has been found starting in version 1.0.0 and prior to 1.10.3 and 1.11.3 on several director endpoints of REST API. To reproduce this vulnerability an authenticated user with permission to access the Director is required (plus api access with regard to the api endpoints). And even though some of these Icinga Director users are restricted from accessing certain objects, are able to retrieve information related to them if their name is known. This makes it possible to change the configuration of these objects by those Icinga Director users restricted from accessing them. This results in further exploitation, data breaches and sensitive information disclosure. Affected endpoints include icingaweb2/director/service, if the host name is left out of the query; icingaweb2/directore/notification; icingaweb2/director/serviceset; and icingaweb2/director/scheduled-downtime. In addition, the endpoint `icingaweb2/director/services?host=filteredHostName` returns a status code 200 even though the services for the host is filtered. This in turn lets the restricted user know that the host `filteredHostName` exists even though the user is restricted from accessing it.  This could again result in further exploitation of this information and data breaches. Icinga Director has patches in versions 1.10.3 and 1.11.1. If upgrading is not feasible, disable the director module for the users other than admin role for the time being.
summary: A security vulnerability has been found in Icinga Director, a config deployment tool, affecting versions 1.0.0 to 1.10.3 and 1.11.3. Authenticated users with permission to access Director can potentially retrieve and change configuration data, leading to data breaches and sensitive information disclosure. Vulnerable endpoints include service, notification, serviceset, and scheduled-downtime. It is recommended to upgrade to patched versions 1.10.3 or 1.11.1, or disable the director module for non-admin users if upgrading is not possible.

description: Discourse is an open-source discussion platform. Prior to versions `3.3.4` on the `stable` branch and `3.4.0.beta5` on the `beta` branch, someone who is about to reach the limit of users in a group DM may send requests to add new users in parallel. The requests might all go through ignoring the limit due to a race condition. The patch in versions `3.3.4` and `3.4.0.beta5` uses the `lock` step in service to wrap part of the `add_users_to_channel` service inside a distributed lock/mutex in order to avoid the race condition.
summary: Discourse, an open-source discussion platform, had a vulnerability that allowed someone to bypass user group limits by sending requests to add new users in parallel. This could lead to the system adding more users than the intended limit due to a race condition. Users of Discourse versions prior to `3.3.4` on the `stable` branch and `3.4.0.beta5` on the `beta` branch are affected by this threat. To protect against this vulnerability, users should update their Discourse platform to versions `3.3.4` or `3.4.0.beta5`, which include a patch to fix the issue by using a distributed lock/mutex to prevent the race condition.

summary: This vulnerability in Riyaz GetSocial allows attackers to execute malicious scripts on a user's web browser, leading to potential data theft or unauthorized actions. description: Discourse is an open-source discussion platform. Versions `3.3.4` and `3.4.0.beta5` contain a patch for the issue. A workaround is available. If a user disables chat in their preferences then they cannot be added to new group chats.
summary: A vulnerability in the Discourse discussion platform prior to versions `3.3.4` and `3.4.0.beta5` allowed users to be added to group direct messages even if they had disabled direct messaging in their preferences. This could pose a privacy threat to users. Users should update to versions `3.3.4` or `3.4.0.beta5` to patch the issue. As a workaround, users can disable chat in their preferences to prevent being added to new group chats.

description: Icinga Web 2 is an open source monitoring web interface, framework and command-line interface. This issue has been resolved in versions 2.11.5 and 2.12.3 of Icinga Web 2. As a workaround, those who have Icinga Web 2.12.2 may enable a content security policy in the application settings.
summary: The CVE describes a vulnerability in Icinga Web 2, a monitoring web interface, that allows an attacker to embed malicious Javascript into the interface by tricking users into visiting a specially crafted URL. This could potentially lead to unauthorized actions being taken on behalf of the user. The vulnerability affects versions of Icinga Web 2 prior to 2.11.5 and 2.12.13. Users should update to versions 2.11.5 or 2.12.3 to resolve the issue. As a temporary workaround, users with version 2.12.2 can enable a content security policy in the application settings.

This affects WP Multistore Locator versions from n/a through 2.5.2. Users should update to the latest version of WP Multistore Locator to patch this vulnerability and protect their data.

description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in NotFound WP Event Ticketing allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects WP Event Ticketing: from n/a through 1.3.4.
summary: This vulnerability in NotFound WP Event Ticketing allows for a type of cyber attack called Cross-site Scripting (XSS), where a hacker can potentially inject malicious code into a website. This vulnerability affects versions of WP Event Ticketing from n/a through 1.3.4. Users should update to a patched version of the software to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in NotFound Driving Directions allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects Driving Directions: from n/a through 1.4.4.
summary: The CVE is about a vulnerability in NotFound Driving Directions that allows for a type of attack called cross-site scripting. This vulnerability affects versions of Driving Directions from n/a through 1.4.4. To protect against this threat, users should update to a version that addresses this issue.

description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in gravity2pdf Gravity 2 PDF allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects Gravity 2 PDF: from n/a through 3.1.3.
summary: This vulnerability in gravity2pdf allows for cross-site scripting attacks, which can be used by attackers to execute malicious scripts on a user's browser when they visit a malicious website or click on a specially crafted link. This vulnerability affects versions of Gravity 2 PDF up to 3.1.3. Users should update to the latest version of the software to protect against this threat.

description: Improper Control of Filename for Include/Require Statement in PHP Program ('PHP Remote File Inclusion') vulnerability in NotFound Docpro allows PHP Local File Inclusion. This issue affects Docpro: from n/a through 2.0.1.
summary: This vulnerability in Docpro allows attackers to include malicious files in PHP programs, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data manipulation. It affects Docpro versions from n/a to 2.0.1. Users should update to a patched version to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

summary: This vulnerability in NotFound Custom Smilies allows attackers to inject malicious code into web pages, putting users at risk of having their personal information stolen or being directed to harmful websites. It affects Custom Smilies versions n/a through 2.9.2. To protect against this vulnerability, users should update to the latest version of Custom Smilies and avoid clicking on unknown or suspicious links.

description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in NotFound SpatialMatch IDX allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects SpatialMatch IDX: from n/a through 3.0.9.
summary: This vulnerability in NotFound SpatialMatch IDX allows attackers to inject malicious code into web pages, potentially leading to account hijacking or unauthorized actions. It affects SpatialMatch IDX versions from n/a through 3.0.9. Users should update to the latest version of the software to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

summary: This vulnerability in ZenphotoPress allows attackers to inject malicious code into web pages, potentially leading to a cross-site scripting attack. This affects ZenphotoPress versions from n/a through 1.8. Users should update to the latest version of ZenphotoPress to protect against this vulnerability.

description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in sureshdsk Are you robot google recaptcha for wordpress allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects Are you robot google recaptcha for wordpress: from n/a through 2.2.
summary: The Are you robot google recaptcha for WordPress plugin version n/a through 2.2 is vulnerable to a Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attack. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts into web pages generated by the plugin. Users of this plugin should update to the latest version to protect against this threat.
software: sureshdsk Are you robot google recaptcha for wordpress

summary: This vulnerability in NotFound Simple Post Series allows for a type of attack called Cross-site Scripting (XSS), where malicious code can be injected into a web page. description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in puzich Fancybox Plus allows Reflected XSS. This issue affects Fancybox Plus: from n/a through 1.0.1.
summary: This CVE is about a security vulnerability in puzich Fancybox Plus that allows for a type of cyber attack called Cross-site Scripting (XSS). This vulnerability affects Fancybox Plus versions from n/a to 1.0.1. Users of this software should update to the latest version to protect against potential attacks.

description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in NotFound WP Google Calendar Manager allows Blind SQL Injection. This issue affects WP Google Calendar Manager: from n/a through 2.1.
summary: The vulnerability in NotFound WP Google Calendar Manager allows attackers to perform Blind SQL Injection, which could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data. Users of WP Google Calendar Manager version n/a through 2.1 should update their software to mitigate this threat.

description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Trust Payments Trust Payments Gateway for WooCommerce allows SQL Injection. This issue affects Trust Payments Gateway for WooCommerce: from n/a through 1.1.4.
summary: This vulnerability in Trust Payments Trust Payments Gateway for WooCommerce allows attackers to inject harmful SQL commands, potentially giving them unauthorized access to sensitive information. This affects users of Trust Payments Gateway for WooCommerce versions from n/a through 1.1.4. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to patch this vulnerability and protect their data.
software: Trust Payments Trust Payments Gateway for WooCommerce

description: There is a risk of unauthorized file uploads in GT-SoftControl and potential file overwrites due to insufficient validation in the file selection process. This could lead to data integrity issues and unauthorized access by an authenticated privileged user.
summary: The CVE poses a threat of unauthorized file uploads and potential overwriting of files in GT-SoftControl, which could result in data integrity issues and unauthorized access by authenticated privileged users. Users should update their software to the latest version to address this vulnerability and prevent potential security breaches.

description: An authenticated attacker can compromise the availability of the device via the network
summary: This CVE refers to a vulnerability that allows someone who has been given permission to access a device to disrupt its availability through the network. This vulnerability could affect a wide range of devices and could lead to service disruptions. To mitigate this threat, users should ensure that their devices are updated with the latest security patches and closely monitor network activity for any signs of unauthorized access.

description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in origincode Product Catalog allows SQL Injection. This issue affects Product Catalog: from n/a through 1.0.4.
summary: The CVE involves a vulnerability in the origincode Product Catalog that allows for SQL Injection, a type of attack where malicious code is inserted into a database query. This vulnerability affects Product Catalog versions from n/a through 1.0.4. To mitigate this threat, users should update their Product Catalog to a secure version and ensure that proper input validation is implemented to prevent SQL Injection attacks.

description: Icinga Web 2 is an open source monitoring web interface, framework and command-line interface. A vulnerability in versions prior to 2.11.5 and 2.12.13 allows an attacker to craft a URL that, once visited by any user, allows to embed arbitrary Javascript into Icinga Web and to act on behalf of that user. This issue has been resolved in versions 2.11.5 and 2.12.3 of Icinga Web 2. As a workaround, those who have Icinga Web 2.12.2 may enable a content security policy in the application settings.
summary: The CVE involves a vulnerability in Icinga Web 2 that allows an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary Javascript on the web interface, potentially compromising user data and actions. This affects users of Icinga Web 2 versions prior to 2.11.5 and 2.12.13. Users should update to version 2.11.5 or 2.12.13 to resolve the issue, or enable a content security policy in version 2.12.2 as a temporary workaround.

description: Icinga Reporting is the central component for reporting related functionality in the monitoring web frontend and framework Icinga Web 2. A vulnerability present in versions 0.10.0 through 1.0.2 allows to set up a template that allows to embed arbitrary Javascript. This enables the attacker to act on behalf of the user, if the template is being previewed; and act on behalf of the headless browser, if a report using the template is printed to PDF. This issue has been resolved in version 1.0.3 of Icinga Reporting. As a workaround, review all templates and remove suspicious settings.
summary: The CVE is a vulnerability found in Icinga Reporting versions 0.10.0 through 1.0.2, where an attacker can embed malicious Javascript in a template, allowing them to impersonate the user or the headless browser. This can be resolved by updating to version 1.0.3 of Icinga Reporting or reviewing and removing suspicious settings from all templates. This threat affects users of Icinga Web 2.

description: Fast CAD Reader application on MacOS was found to be installed with incorrect file permissions (rwxrwxrwx). This is inconsistent with standard macOS security practices, where applications should have drwxr-xr-x permissions. Incorrect permissions allow for Dylib Hijacking. Guest account, other users and applications can exploit this vulnerability for privilege escalation. This issue affects Fast CAD Reader in possibly all versions since the vendor has not responded to our messages. The tested version was 4.1.5
summary: The Fast CAD Reader application on MacOS has a security vulnerability due to incorrect file permissions, which could allow malicious users or applications to gain higher levels of access than they should have. This vulnerability affects all versions of Fast CAD Reader, including version 4.1.5. To protect against this threat, users should be cautious when using the application and consider uninstalling it until the vendor releases a fix.

description: Incorrect handle provided in unspecified circumstances in Mojo in Google Chrome on Windows prior to 134.0.6998.177 allowed a remote attacker to perform a sandbox escape via a malicious file. (Chromium security severity: High)
summary: This security vulnerability in Google Chrome on Windows could allow a remote attacker to escape the browser's sandbox and execute malicious code through a file. The threat affects users of Google Chrome on Windows devices. To mitigate this risk, users should update their Chrome browser to version 134.0.6998.177 or higher.

description: CrushFTP versions 10.0.0 through 10.8.3 and 11.0.0 through 11.3.0 are affected by a vulnerability that may result in unauthenticated access. Remote and unauthenticated HTTP requests to CrushFTP may allow attackers to gain unauthorized access.
summary: The CrushFTP software versions 10.0.0 through 10.8.3 and 11.0.0 through 11.3.0 have a vulnerability that could allow unauthorized access by remote attackers. This could affect anyone using CrushFTP, potentially leading to data breaches or other security issues. Users should update their CrushFTP software to a version that has resolved this vulnerability to protect against unauthorized access.

description: Icinga Web 2 is an open source monitoring web interface, framework and command-line interface. A vulnerability in versions prior to 2.11.5 and 2.12.13 allows an attacker to craft a request that, once transmitted to a victim's Icinga Web, allows to embed arbitrary Javascript into it and to act on behalf of that user. This issue has been resolved in versions 2.11.5 and 2.12.3 of Icinga Web 2. As a workaround, those who have Icinga Web 2.12.2 may enable a content security policy in the application settings. Any modern browser with a working CORS implementation also sufficiently guards against the vulnerability.
summary: The vulnerability in Icinga Web 2 versions prior to 2.11.5 and 2.12.13 allows attackers to embed arbitrary Javascript and act on behalf of users. This issue has been fixed in versions 2.11.5 and 2.12.3. Users should update their Icinga Web 2 to the latest version to protect against this vulnerability. In the meantime, enabling a content security policy or using a browser with a working CORS implementation can also offer some protection.

description: Icinga Web 2 is an open source monitoring web interface, framework and command-line interface. A vulnerability in versions prior to 2.11.5 and 2.12.13 vulnerability allows an attacker to craft a URL that, once visited by an authenticated user (or one that is able to authenticate), allows to manipulate the backend to redirect the user to any location. This issue has been resolved in versions 2.11.5 and 2.12.3 of Icinga Web 2. No known workarounds are available.
summary: The vulnerability in Icinga Web 2 versions prior to 2.11.5 and 2.12.13 allows an attacker to manipulate the backend to redirect authenticated users to a harmful website. This affects users of Icinga Web 2. To mitigate this threat, users should update to versions 2.11.5 or 2.12.13, as no known workarounds are available.

description: Frappe is a full-stack web application framework. Prior to versions 14.93.2 and 15.55.0, a SQL Injection vulnerability has been identified in Frappe Framework which could allow a malicious actor to access sensitive information. Versions 14.93.2 and 15.55.0 contain a patch for the issue. No known workarounds are available.
summary: A SQL Injection vulnerability has been found in the Frappe Framework, a web application framework, which could allow attackers to access sensitive information. Users of versions prior to 14.93.2 and 15.55.0 are affected. It is recommended to update to the latest versions containing a patch for the vulnerability to protect against potential attacks. No other known solutions are available.

description: Directus is a real-time API and App dashboard for managing SQL database content. The `@directus/storage-driver-s3` package starting in version 9.22.0 and prior to version 12.0.1, corresponding to Directus starting in version 9.22.0 and prior to 11.5.0, is vulnerable to asset unavailability after a burst of malformed transformations. When making many malformed transformation requests at once, at some point, all assets are served as 403. This causes denial of assets for all policies of Directus, including Admin and Public. Version 12.0.1 of the `@directus/storage-driver-s3` package, corresponding to version 11.5.0 of Directus, fixes the issue.
summary: There is a vulnerability in the Directus API and App dashboard that allows attackers to cause a denial of assets for all policies by making many malformed transformation requests at once. This affects Directus versions prior to 11.5.0. Users should update to version 11.5.0 of Directus to fix this issue.

description: Directus is a real-time API and App dashboard for managing SQL database content. The `@directus/storage-driver-s3` package starting in version 9.22.0 and prior to version 12.0.1, corresponding to Directus starting in version 9.22.0 and prior to 11.5.0, is vulnerable to asset unavailability after a burst of HEAD requests. Some tools use Directus to sync content and assets, and some of those tools use the HEAD method to check the existence of files. When making many HEAD requests at once, at some point, all assets are eventually served as 403. This causes denial of assets for all policies of Directus, including Admin and Public. Version 12.0.1 of the `@directus/storage-driver-s3` package, corresponding to version 11.5.0 of Directus, fixes the issue.
summary: The CVE affects users of Directus, a real-time API and App dashboard. Specifically, the vulnerability is in the `@directus/storage-driver-s3` package versions 9.22.0 to 12.0.1. The threat arises when a burst of HEAD requests causes asset unavailability, leading to denial of assets for all Directus policies. Users should update to version 12.0.1 of the package to fix this issue and ensure the security of their assets.

description: An issue in Arris NVG443B 9.3.0h3d36 allows a physically proximate attacker to execute arbitrary code via the cshell login component.
summary: This vulnerability in the Arris NVG443B router allows a hacker who is physically close to the device to run any code they want through the cshell login component. This could potentially compromise the security of the router and any connected devices. Users of this router should update to the latest firmware to patch this vulnerability and protect their network from potential attacks.

description:
Client side access control bypass in the permission component in 
Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows. An authenticated user can exploit this flaw to bypass certain permission restrictions—specifically View Password, Edit Asset, and Edit Permissions by performing specific actions. 

This issue affects Remote Desktop Manager versions from 2025.1.24 through 2025.1.25, and all versions up to 2024.3.29.
summary: The CVE refers to a security flaw in Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows, which allows an authenticated user to bypass certain permission restrictions. This issue affects specific versions of the Remote Desktop Manager software. Users should update to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

description:
Improper authorization in application password policy in Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows allows an authenticated user to 
use a configuration different from the one mandated by the system administrators.





This issue affects Remote Desktop Manager versions from 2025.1.24 through 2025.1.25, and all versions up to 2024.3.29.
summary: This vulnerability allows an authenticated user to bypass the password policy set by system administrators in Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows. It affects versions from 2024.3.29 to 2025.1.25. Users should update to the latest version of the software to mitigate this issue.

description:
Insufficient logging in the autotyping feature in Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows allows an authenticated user to use a stored password without generating a corresponding log event, via the use of the autotyping functionality.







This issue affects Remote Desktop Manager versions from 2025.1.24 through 2025.1.25, and all versions up to 2024.3.29.
summary:
CVE Summary:

A vulnerability in Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows allows an authenticated user to use a stored password without being recorded in the log, using the autotyping feature. This issue affects versions from 2025.1.24 to 2025.1.25 and all versions up to 2024.3.29.

Action:

Users should update their Remote Desktop Manager to the latest version available to patch this vulnerability and ensure secure password management.

description:
Improper authorization in the variable component in Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows allows an authenticated password to use the ELEVATED_PASSWORD variable even though not allowed by the "Allow password in variable policy". 





This issue affects Remote Desktop Manager versions from 2025.1.24 through 2025.1.25, and all versions up to 2024.3.29.
summary: This CVE affects Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager on Windows by allowing an authenticated user to use a password variable that is not allowed by the security policy. This vulnerability impacts versions from 2025.1.24 through 2025.1.25 and all versions up to 2024.3.29. Users should update to the latest version of Remote Desktop Manager to mitigate this threat.

description: Directus is a real-time API and App dashboard for managing SQL database content. Starting in version 10.10.0 and prior to version 11.5.0, a suspended user can use the token generated in session auth mode to access the API despite their status. This happens because there is a check missing in `verifySessionJWT` to verify that a user is actually still active and allowed to access the API. One can extract the session token obtained by, e.g. login in to the app while still active and then, after the user has been suspended continue to use that token until it expires. Version 11.5.0 patches the issue.
summary: A vulnerability in Directus allows a suspended user to access the API using a token generated in session auth mode, even after their status has been suspended. This affects users of Directus versions 10.10.0 to 11.4.9. To fix this issue, users should update to version 11.5.0 or later.

description: Directus is a real-time API and App dashboard for managing SQL database content. Starting in version 9.0.0-alpha.4 and prior to version 11.5.0, the `search` query parameter allows users with access to a collection to filter items based on fields they do not have permission to view. This allows the enumeration of unknown field contents. The searchable columns (numbers & strings) are not checked against permissions when injecting the `where` clauses for applying the search query. This leads to the possibility of enumerating those un-permitted fields. Version 11.5.0 fixes the issue.
summary: This vulnerability in Directus allows users to filter items based on fields they do not have permission to view, leading to the enumeration of unknown field contents. It affects users of Directus versions 9.0.0-alpha.4 to 11.4.0. To address this issue, users should update to version 11.5.0 which includes a fix for the vulnerability.

description: Directus is a real-time API and App dashboard for managing SQL database content. Starting in version 9.12.0 and prior to version 11.5.0, when a Flow with the "Webhook" trigger and the "Data of Last Operation" response body encounters a ValidationError thrown by a failed condition operation, the API response includes sensitive data. This includes environmental variables, sensitive API keys, user accountability information, and operational data. This issue poses a significant security risk, as any unintended exposure of this data could lead to potential misuse. Version 11.5.0 fixes the issue.
summary: A security vulnerability in Directus versions 9.12.0 to 11.4.9 allows sensitive data, such as API keys and operational data, to be exposed in API responses when certain conditions are met. This could lead to the misuse of this data by unauthorized users. Users should update to version 11.5.0 to fix this issue and avoid potential security breaches.

description: HTTP Response Manipulation in SCRIPT CASE v.1.0.002 Build7 allows a remote attacker to escalate privileges via a crafted request.
summary: A vulnerability in SCRIPT CASE v.1.0.002 Build7 allows a remote attacker to gain higher privileges by sending a specially crafted request. This affects users of this specific version of SCRIPT CASE. Users should update to a newer version or apply any patches provided by the vendor to protect against this threat.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 is vulnerable to Information Disclosure via the parameter getUserNamePassword.
summary: The Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 device is at risk of revealing sensitive information through a parameter called getUserNamePassword. This vulnerability could affect users of this device, potentially exposing their username and password information. Users should update their device to the latest version or take steps to mitigate this risk.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 is affected by an unauthorized stack overflow vulnerability when requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setSyncTimeHost.
summary: The Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 device is vulnerable to an unauthorized stack overflow attack when trying to change the synchronization time host. This vulnerability could be exploited by hackers to gain unauthorized access to the device. Users of this device should update to the latest version of the firmware to mitigate the risk of this vulnerability being exploited.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 is affected by an unauthorized command execution vulnerability when requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setAutorest.
summary: The Telesquare TLR-2005KSH version 1.1.4 is vulnerable to an unauthorized command execution issue. This vulnerability can be exploited by requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setAutorest. This could affect users of this device by allowing attackers to execute unauthorized commands on the system. To protect against this vulnerability, users should update to a patched version of the software provided by the manufacturer.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 is vulnerable to unauthorized stack buffer overflow vulnerability when requesting admin.cgi parameter with setDdns.
summary: The Telesquare TLR-2005KSH version 1.1.4 is vulnerable to a stack buffer overflow that could be exploited by an unauthorized attacker when requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setDdns. This vulnerability could affect users of this specific model of router. Users should update their firmware to the latest version to protect against this vulnerability.

description: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in ScriptCase before v1.0.003 - Build 3 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted payload to the "Connection Name" in the New Connection and Rename Connection pages.
summary: This vulnerability in ScriptCase allows attackers to run their code by inputting a malicious payload into the “Connection Name” field. This affects users of ScriptCase versions before v1.0.003 - Build 3. To stay protected, users should update their ScriptCase software to the latest version available.

description: An issue was discovered in Appsmith before 1.51. A user on Appsmith that doesn't have admin permissions can trigger the restart API on Appsmith, causing a server restart. This is still within the Appsmith container, and the impact is limited to Appsmith's own server only, but there is a denial of service because it can be continually restarted. This is due to incorrect access control checks, which should check for super user permissions on the incoming request.
summary: This vulnerability in Appsmith allows a regular user to repeatedly restart the server, causing a denial of service. This flaw only affects Appsmith servers running version 1.51 or earlier. To mitigate the risk, affected users should update to the latest version of Appsmith to ensure proper access control checks are in place.

description: An issue was discovered in Appsmith before 1.52. An incorrectly configured PostgreSQL instance in the Appsmith image leads to remote command execution inside the Appsmith Docker container. The attacker must be able to access Appsmith, login to it, create a datasource, create a query against that datasource, and execute that query.
summary: This vulnerability in Appsmith allows attackers to remotely execute commands within the Appsmith Docker container if they can access and login to the platform. This could potentially affect any user of Appsmith running versions before 1.52. Users should update to the latest version of Appsmith to patch this issue and improve security.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 is vulnerable to unauthorized stack overflow vulnerability when requesting admin.cgi parameter with setNtp.
summary: This CVE refers to a vulnerability in the Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 device that could allow attackers to perform unauthorized stack overflow attacks by requesting a specific parameter. This vulnerability affects users of this specific device model. Users should update to the latest firmware version or implement patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 has an unauthorized stack overflow vulnerability when requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setAutorest.
summary: The Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 has a vulnerability that could allow attackers to remotely execute code on the device by exploiting an unauthorized stack overflow issue. This could potentially affect anyone using this specific device model. To protect against this threat, users should update the firmware to the latest version or apply any available security patches provided by the manufacturer.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 has an unauthorized stack overflow vulnerability in the login interface when requesting systemtil.cgi.
summary: The Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 device has a security vulnerability that allows unauthorized users to overload the system through the login interface when requesting a specific file. This vulnerability could be exploited by attackers to compromise the device and gain unauthorized access. Users of this device should update to the latest version of the firmware to patch this vulnerability and prevent potential security risks.

description: In Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4, an unauthorized stack overflow vulnerability exists when requesting admin.cgi parameter with setSyncTimeHost.
summary: This vulnerability in Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 allows attackers to execute malicious code through an authorized stack overflow when using the admin.cgi parameter with setSyncTimeHost. It affects users of this specific device and firmware version. Users should update to a patched version or apply recommended security measures to prevent exploitation.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 has an Information Disclosure vulnerability when requesting systemutilit.cgi.
summary: This vulnerability in Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 allows for information disclosure when a specific system utility request is made. This threat affects users of this specific model of Telesquare routers. Users should update their software to the latest version to prevent potential unauthorized access to their information.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 allows unauthorized password modification when requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setUserNamePassword.
summary: A vulnerability in Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 allows attackers to change the password without authorization by requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setUserNamePassword. This vulnerability affects users of Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4. To mitigate this threat, users should immediately update their firmware to the latest version and monitor for any unauthorized password changes.

description: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 has an unauthorized stack overflow vulnerability when requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setUsernamePassword.
summary: Telesquare TLR-2005KSH 1.1.4 has a security vulnerability that allows attackers to trigger a stack overflow by requesting the admin.cgi parameter with setUsernamePassword. This could potentially be exploited by malicious actors to gain unauthorized access to the device. Users of this device should update to the latest version or apply any available security patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: Unauthorized stack overflow vulnerability in Telesquare TLR-2005KSH v.1.1.4 allows a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information via the systemutil.cgi component.
summary: This vulnerability in Telesquare TLR-2005KSH v.1.1.4 allows a remote attacker to gain access to sensitive information by causing a stack overflow. This vulnerability affects users of the Telesquare TLR-2005KSH v.1.1.4 system. To protect against this threat, users should update their system to the latest version and ensure proper security measures are in place.

description: An issue was discovered in OPC cardsystems Webapp Aufwertung 2.1.0. The reference assigned to transactions can be reused. When completing a payment, the first or all transactions with the same reference are completed, depending on timing. This can be used to transfer more money onto employee cards than is paid.
summary: The CVE involves a vulnerability in OPC cardsystems Webapp Aufwertung 2.1.0 where references assigned to transactions can be reused, potentially allowing for unauthorized transfers of money onto employee cards. This threat affects users of the Webapp Aufwertung 2.1.0 system. To mitigate this risk, users should update to the latest version of the software and monitor transaction references for any unusual activity.

description: An issue was discovered in Appsmith before 1.51. Users invited as "App Viewer" incorrectly have access to development information of a workspace (specifically, a list of datasources in a workspace they're a member of). This information disclosure does not expose sensitive data in the datasources, such as database passwords and API Keys.
summary:
CVE Summary:
A vulnerability in Appsmith before version 1.51 allows users invited as "App Viewer" to access development information in a workspace, including a list of datasources. This disclosure does not expose sensitive data like passwords or API Keys. It affects users of Appsmith who are assigned the role of "App Viewer." To mitigate this issue, users should update to version 1.51 or newer.

description:
KNIME Business Hub is affected by the Ingress-nginx CVE-2025-1974 ( a.k.a IngressNightmare ) vulnerability which affects the ingress-nginx component. In the worst case a complete takeover of the Kubernetes cluster is possible. Since the affected component is only reachable from within the cluster, i.e. requires an authenticated user, the severity in the context of KNIME Business Hub is slightly lower.



Besides applying the publicly known workarounds, we strongly recommend updating to one of the following versions of KNIME Business Hub: 



  *  1.13.3 or above 






  *  1.12.4 or above 






  *  1.11.4 or above 






  *  1.10.4 or above








  *
summary: The Ingress-nginx CVE-2025-1974 vulnerability, also known as IngressNightmare, affects KNIME Business Hub. This vulnerability could potentially allow for a complete takeover of the Kubernetes cluster. While the severity is slightly lower due to requiring an authenticated user, it is still important to take action. To mitigate this threat, users should apply publicly known workarounds and update KNIME Business Hub to version 1.13.3 or above, 1.12.4 or above, 1.11.4 or above, or 1.10.4 or above.

description: atop through 2.11.0 allows local users to cause a denial of service (e.g., assertion failure and application exit) or possibly have unspecified other impact by running certain types of unprivileged processes while a different user runs atop.
summary: This vulnerability in atop version 2.11.0 allows local users to cause a denial of service or potentially have other impacts by running certain unprivileged processes while another user runs atop. Users should update to a patched version of atop to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.4.1, 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.3.2408.107, 9.2.2406.111, and 9.1.2308.214, a low-privileged user that does not hold the "admin" or "power" Splunk roles could run a saved search with a risky command using the permissions of a higher-privileged user to bypass the SPL safeguards for risky commands on the "/services/streams/search" endpoint through its "q" parameter. The vulnerability requires the attacker to phish the victim by tricking them into initiating a request within their browser. The authenticated user should not be able to exploit the vulnerability at will.
summary: This CVE affects users of Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.4.1, 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8, as well as Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.3.2408.107, 9.2.2406.111, and 9.1.2308.214. It allows a low-privileged user to run risky commands using the permissions of a higher-privileged user, potentially bypassing security measures. To mitigate this threat, users should update their Splunk software to the latest versions.

description: In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.4.1, 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8, and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.3.2408.107, 9.2.2406.112, 9.2.2403.115, 9.1.2312.208 and 9.1.2308.214, a low-privileged user that does not hold the "admin" or "power" Splunk roles could bypass the external content warning modal dialog box in Dashboard Studio dashboards which could lead to an information disclosure.
summary: A security vulnerability in certain versions of Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Cloud Platform allows a low-privileged user to bypass certain security measures and potentially access sensitive information. Users should update their software to the latest versions to mitigate this threat.

description: In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.2.2403.108, and 9.1.2312.204, a low-privileged user that does not hold the "admin" or "power" Splunk roles could change the maintenance mode state of App Key Value Store (KVStore) through a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF).
summary: This vulnerability in Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Cloud Platform allows a low-privileged user to change the maintenance mode state of App Key Value Store through a Cross-Site Request Forgery attack. This could potentially disrupt the functioning of the system. Users of affected versions should update to the latest versions (9.3.3, 9.2.5, 9.1.8 for Splunk Enterprise and 9.2.2403.108, 9.1.2312.204 for Splunk Cloud Platform) to protect against this threat.

description: In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.3.3, 9.2.5,  and 9.1.8, and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.3.2408.104, 9.2.2406.108, 9.2.2403.114, and 9.1.2312.208, a low-privileged user that does not hold the "admin" or "power" Splunk roles could perform a Remote Code Execution (RCE) through a file upload to the "$SPLUNK_HOME/var/run/splunk/apptemp" directory due to missing authorization checks.
summary: This CVE affects users of Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8, as well as Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.3.2408.104, 9.2.2406.108, 9.2.2403.114, and 9.1.2312.208. It allows a low-privileged user without admin or power roles to perform Remote Code Execution (RCE) by uploading a file to a specific directory. To mitigate this threat, users should update their Splunk software to the latest version.

description:
In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.4.1, 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8, and versions below 3.8.38 and 3.7.23 of the Splunk Secure Gateway app on Splunk Cloud Platform, a low-privileged user that does not hold the “admin“ or “power“ Splunk roles could run a search using the permissions of a higher-privileged user that could lead to disclosure of sensitive information.

The vulnerability requires the attacker to phish the victim by tricking them into initiating a request within their browser. The authenticated low-privileged user should not be able to exploit the vulnerability at will.
summary: There is a vulnerability in certain versions of Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Secure Gateway app that allows a low-privileged user to run a search using higher-privileged user permissions, potentially leading to disclosure of sensitive information. Users of affected versions should update to the latest versions to patch this vulnerability and prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data. Be cautious when clicking on suspicious links or requests in your browser to avoid falling victim to phishing attacks.

description:
In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.3.2408.103, 9.2.2406.108, 9.2.2403.113, 9.1.2312.208 and 9.1.2308.212, a low-privileged user that does not hold the “admin“ or “power“ Splunk roles could run a saved search with a risky command using the permissions of a higher-privileged user to bypass the SPL safeguards for risky commands on the “/app/search/search“ endpoint through its “s“ parameter.
The vulnerability requires the attacker to phish the victim by tricking them into initiating a request within their browser. The authenticated user should not be able to exploit the vulnerability at will.
summary: This CVE is a security vulnerability in Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Cloud Platform that allows a low-privileged user to run risky commands using the permissions of a higher-privileged user. This could potentially bypass security safeguards. The threat affects users of certain versions of Splunk software. To address this issue, users should update their Splunk Enterprise to versions 9.3.3, 9.2.5, or 9.1.8, and their Splunk Cloud Platform to versions 9.3.2408.103, 9.2.2406.108, 9.2.2403.113, 9.1.2312.208, or 9.1.2308.212. Additionally, users should be cautious of phishing attempts that could exploit this vulnerability.

description: In the Splunk App for Lookup File Editing versions below 4.0.5, a script in the app used the `chmod` and `makedirs` Python functions in a way that resulted in overly broad read and execute permissions. This could lead to improper access control for a low-privileged user.
summary: The CVE describes a vulnerability in the Splunk App for Lookup File Editing versions below 4.0.5, where a script used certain Python functions in a way that granted overly broad permissions to certain files. This could potentially allow a low-privileged user to access files they shouldn't have access to. Users of this app should update to version 4.0.5 or higher to mitigate this risk.
software: Splunk App for Lookup File Editing

description:
Silicon Labs Gecko OS HTTP Request Handling Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Silicon Labs Gecko OS. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

The specific flaw exists within the handling of HTTP requests. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the device. Was ZDI-CAN-23245.
summary: This vulnerability in Silicon Labs Gecko OS allows attackers near the network to run their code on affected devices without needing authentication. By sending a specially crafted HTTP request, attackers can trigger a stack-based buffer overflow, which can lead to remote code execution. Users should immediately apply the necessary security patches or updates provided by Silicon Labs to mitigate this risk.

description:
Silicon Labs Gecko OS DNS Response Processing Infinite Loop Denial-of-Service Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of Silicon Labs Gecko OS. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

The specific flaw exists within the processing of DNS responses. The issue results from a logic error that can lead to an infinite loop. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to create a denial-of-service condition on the system. Was ZDI-CAN-23392.
summary: This vulnerability in Silicon Labs Gecko OS allows attackers near the network to create a denial-of-service attack without needing authentication. By exploiting a flaw in the processing of DNS responses, an attacker can trigger an infinite loop that can crash the system. Users should apply the necessary patches or updates provided by Silicon Labs to protect against this vulnerability.

description: Local privilege escalation due to a binary hijacking vulnerability. The following products are affected: Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud Agent (Windows) before build 39713.
summary: This vulnerability allows a local attacker to gain higher privileges on a Windows system by exploiting a flaw in the Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud Agent software. Users of Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud Agent (Windows) before build 39713 are affected. To mitigate this threat, users should update their software to the latest version available.

description:
In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.4.1, 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8, and versions below 3.8.38 and 3.7.23 of the Splunk Secure Gateway app on Splunk Cloud Platform, a low-privileged user that does not hold the “admin“ or “power“ Splunk roles could edit and delete other user data in App Key Value Store (KVStore) collections that the Splunk Secure Gateway app created. This is due to missing access control and incorrect ownership of the data in those KVStore collections.

In the affected versions, the `nobody` user owned the data in the KVStore collections. This meant that there was no specific owner assigned to the data in those collections.
summary: A vulnerability has been found in certain versions of Splunk Enterprise and the Splunk Secure Gateway app on Splunk Cloud Platform which allows low-privileged users to edit and delete other user data in Key Value Store (KVStore) collections. This could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive information. Users should update to Splunk Enterprise versions 9.4.1, 9.3.3, 9.2.5, and 9.1.8, or versions 3.8.38 and 3.7.23 of the Splunk Secure Gateway app to address this issue.

description: The Export All Posts, Products, Orders, Refunds & Users plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 2.13 via deserialization of untrusted input in the 'returnMetaValueAsCustomerInput' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.

However, it only poses a threat if another plugin or theme containing a particular type of vulnerability is also installed on the site.
